title: Structured Prompting for Beginners
why: The 'Structured Prompting for Beginners' exam challenges beginners with a deeper exploration into effective prompt construction, handling edge cases, response evaluation, prompt patterns, and mitigation of AI hallucinations. It helps users transition from basic prompt users to intentional, efficient prompt engineers.

questions.question: Which of the following is a major cause of AI hallucination?
How can you reduce hallucinated facts in AI responses?
options: Specify data sources or ask for citations
questions.correctAnswer: Specify data sources or ask for citations

questions.question: What does the 'zero-shot' technique imply in prompting?
options: No examples are given in the prompt
questions.correctAnswer: No examples are given in the prompt

questions.question: Why is step-by-step reasoning important in complex prompts?
options: To guide the model logically toward a better answer
questions.correctAnswer: To guide the model logically toward a better answer

questions.question: Which method is ideal for improving accuracy in numerical tasks?
Which is most likely to prevent biased outputs?
What does the token limit include?
Which of the following best defines 'prompt leakage'?
options: When your prompt is too short
When the AI generates its own prompt
When the prompt reveals internal instructions unintentionally
When tokens are saved in memory
questions.correctAnswer: When the prompt reveals internal instructions unintentionally

questions.question: Which strategy is best when the model gives inconsistent answers?
options: Make prompts more detailed and structured
questions.correctAnswer: Make prompts more detailed and structured

questions.question: What type of prompt would suit classification problems?
Which technique adds logic-based reasoning into the prompt?
What makes role-based prompting effective?
options: Assigns expertise and context to the AI
questions.correctAnswer: Assigns expertise and context to the AI

questions.question: Which prompt leads to more reliable outputs?
options: Can you tell me something about anything?
What happened yesterday in the world?
List 3 verified facts about Mars from NASA reports.
questions.correctAnswer: List 3 verified facts about Mars from NASA reports.

questions.question: Why should you avoid overloading a prompt with multiple unrelated tasks?
options: It makes the AI more creative

questions.question: Which setting would you adjust to increase determinism?
What is a drawback of excessively long prompts?
What is a 'meta prompt'?
options: A prompt that analyzes another prompt
questions.correctAnswer: A prompt that analyzes another prompt

questions.question: Which would likely yield better structure in answers?
What kind of bias may occur when AI sees certain trigger words in prompts?

options: To know how fast the AI is
To check relevance, accuracy, and tone
questions.correctAnswer: To check relevance, accuracy, and tone

questions.question: How do you best structure a comparative prompt?
options: Ask AI to compare X and Y with clear context and criteria
questions.correctAnswer: Ask AI to compare X and Y with clear context and criteria

questions.question: Which is NOT a typical step in iterative prompting?
What helps ensure factual correctness in AI outputs?
How can you handle hallucinations in creative tasks?
options: Tell the AI to only use real facts
Provide creative context and set boundaries
questions.correctAnswer: Provide creative context and set boundaries

questions.question: Why does prompt specificity matter?

questions.correctAnswer: It improves reproducibility and relevance of answers
